1.text: “But now, O Job, hear my speech, and listen to all my words.

2.text: Behold, I will open my mouth; my address is on the tip of my tongue.

3.text: My words are from an upright heart, and my lips speak sincerely what I know.

4.text: The Spirit of God has made me, and the breath of the Almighty gives me life.

5.text: Refute me if you can; prepare your case and confront me.

6.text: I am just like you before God; I was also formed from clay.

7.text: Surely no fear of me should terrify you; nor will my hand be heavy upon you.

8.text: Surely you have spoken in my hearing, and I have heard these very words:

9.text: ‘I am pure, without transgression; I am clean, with no iniquity in me.

10.text: Yet God finds occasions against me; He counts me as His enemy.

11.text: He puts my feet in the stocks; He watches over all my paths.’

12.text: Behold, you are not right in this matter. I will answer you, for God is greater than man.

13.text: Why do you complain to Him that He answers nothing a man asks?

14.text: For God speaks in one way and in another, yet no one notices.

15.text: In a dream, in a vision in the night, when deep sleep falls upon men as they slumber on their beds,

16.text: He opens their ears and terrifies them with warnings

17.text: to turn a man from wrongdoing and keep him from pride,

18.text: to preserve his soul from the Pit and his life from perishing by the sword.

19.text: A man is also chastened on his bed with pain and constant distress in his bones,

20.text: so that he detests his bread, and his soul loathes his favorite food.

21.text: His flesh wastes away from sight, and his hidden bones protrude.

22.text: He draws near to the Pit, and his life to the messengers of death.

23.text: Yet if there is a messenger on his side, one mediator in a thousand, to tell a man what is right for him,

24.text: to be gracious to him and say, ‘Spare him from going down to the Pit; I have found his ransom,’

25.text: then his flesh is refreshed like a child’s; he returns to the days of his youth.

26.text: He prays to God and finds favor; he sees God’s face and shouts for joy, and God restores His righteousness to that man.

27.text: Then he sings before men with these words: ‘I have sinned and perverted what was right; yet I did not get what I deserved.

28.text: He redeemed my soul from going down to the Pit, and I will live to see the light.’

29.text: Behold, all these things God does to a man, two or even three times,

30.text: to bring back his soul from the Pit, that he may be enlightened with the light of life.

31.text: Pay attention, Job, and listen to me; be silent, and I will speak.

32.text: But if you have something to say, answer me; speak up, for I would like to vindicate you.

33.text: But if not, then listen to me; be quiet, and I will teach you wisdom.”
